metadata.title: CVE-2019-13031 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low
metadata.description:
LemonLDAP::NG before 1.9.20 has an XML External Entity (XXE) issue whensubmitting a notification to the notification server. By default, thenotification server is not enabled and has a "deny all" rule.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13031` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lemonldap-ng - 2.0.2+ds-6
lemonldap-ng-fastcgi-server - 2.0.2+ds-6
lemonldap-ng-handler - 2.0.2+ds-6
lemonldap-ng-uwsgi-app - 2.0.2+ds-6
liblemonldap-ng-common-perl - 2.0.2+ds-6
liblemonldap-ng-handler-perl - 2.0.2+ds-6
liblemonldap-ng-manager-perl - 2.0.2+ds-6
liblemonldap-ng-portal-perl - 2.0.2+ds-6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lemonldap-ng package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.2+ds-6').
